main event: A bright, ruby-colored object was sighted in the sky over Danville, California on August 2, 1955.
interesting points: The object was brilliant in color and faded from view as it passed through 40 degrees in less than one minute.
The sighting was made by an unidentified civilian observer from a ground control center post.
The object was observed using 7.5x50 Navy binoculars.
The report was investigated and determined to be possibly astronomical in nature, possibly a meteor.
The report was filed seven years after the incident, making it difficult to properly investigate or analyze.
